trans-unit.source: Encapsulates principals that are computer accounts.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ComputerPrincipal"></xref> class and assigns it to the specified context.
The computer principal account is not persisted when it is created.
To save the account, call the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal.Save%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalContext"></xref> that specifies the server or domain against which operations are performed.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ComputerPrincipal"></xref> class by using the specified context, SAM account name, password, and enabled value.
The computer principal account is not persisted when it is created.
To persist the account, call the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal.Save%2A> method.
The <xref:System.DirectoryService.AccountManagement.PrincipalContext> that specifies the server or domain against which operations are performed.
The SAM account name for this computer principal.
The password for this account.
A Boolean value that specifies whether the account is enabled.

Returns a <xref:System.DirectoryService.AccountManagement.PrincipalSearchResult%271> collection of <xref:System.DirectoryService.AccountManagement.ComputerPincipal> objects that have had bad password attempts within the parameters specified.
The time will default to UTC.
If you want to specify the time in local time, then specify the <xref:System.DateTime.Kind%2A> property of the `time` object as <xref:DateTimeKind.Local>.
The <xref:System.DirectoryService.AccountManagement.PrincipalContext> that specifies the server or domain against which operations are performed.
A <xref:System.DateTime> structure that is used in conjunction with the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.MatchType"></xref> to find computers with bad password attempts.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.MatchType"></xref> that specifies the type of comparison to use in the search.

A <xref:System.DirectoryService.AccountManagement.PrincipalSearchResult%271> that contains one or more <xref:System.DirectoryService.AccountManagement.ComputerPincipal> objects that match the search parameters, or an empty collection if no matches are found.

Returns a <xref:System.DirectoryService.AccountManagement.PrincipalSearchResult%271> collection of <xref:System.DirectoryService.AccountManagement.ComputerPincipal> objects that have an expiration time within the specified date and time range.
The time will default to UTC.
If you want to specify the time in local time, then specify the <xref:System.DateTime.Kind%2A> property of the `time` object as <xref:DateTimeKind.Local>.
The <xref:System.DirectoryService.AccountManagement.PrincipalContext> that specifies the server or domain against which operations are performed.
A <xref:System.DateTime> structure that is used in conjunction with the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.MatchType"></xref> to filter search results.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.MatchType"></xref> that specifies the type of comparison to use in the search.

A <xref:System.DirectoryService.AccountManagement.PrincipalSearchResult%271> that contains one or more <xref:System.DirectoryService.AccountManagement.ComputerPincipal> objects that match the search parameters, or an empty collection if no matches are found.
Returns a computer principal object that matches the specified identity value.
The <xref:System.DirectoryService.AccountManagement.PrincipalContext> that specifies the server or domain against which operations are performed.
The identity of the computer.
This parameter can be any format that is contained in the <xref:System.DirectoryService.AccountManagement.IdentityType> enumeration.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ComputerPrincipal"></xref> object that matches the specified identity value, or null if no matches are found.
Multiple computer principal objects matching the current computer object were found.
Returns a computer principal object that matches the specified identity type and value.
This version of the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ComputerPrincipal.FindByIdentity*> method determines the format of the identity value.
The <xref:System.DirectoryService.AccountManagement.PrincipalContext> that specifies the server or domain against which operations are performed.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.IdentityType"></xref> enumeration value that specifies the format of the `identityValue` parameter.
The identity of the computer.
This parameter can be any format that is contained in the <xref:System.DirectoryService.AccountManagement.IdentityType> enumeration.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ComputerPrincipal"></xref> object that matches the specified identity value and type, or null if no matches are found.
Multiple computer principal objects matching the current computer object were found.
The identity value is not a valid <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.IdentityType"></xref> enumeration value.

Returns a <xref:System.DirectoryService.AccountManagement.PrincipalSearchResult%271> collection of <xref:System.DirectoryService.AccountManagement.ComputerPincipal> objects that have a lockout time within the specified date and time range.
The time will default to UTC.
If you want to specify the time in local time, then specify the <xref:System.DateTime.Kind%2A> property of the `time` object as <xref:DateTimeKind.Local>.
The <xref:System.DirectoryService.AccountManagement.PrincipalContext> that specifies the server or domain against which operations are performed.
A <xref:System.DateTime> structure that is used in conjunction with the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.MatchType"></xref> to filter search results.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.MatchType"></xref> that specifies the type of comparison to use in the search.

A <xref:System.DirectoryService.AccountManagement.PrincipalSearchResult%271> that contains one or more <xref:System.DirectoryService.AccountManagement.ComputerPincipal> objects that match the search parameters, or an empty collection if no matches are found.

Returns a <xref:System.DirectoryService.AccountManagement.PrincipalSearchResult%271> collection of <xref:System.DirectoryService.AccountManagement.ComputerPincipal> objects that have a logon time within the specified date and time range.
The time will default to UTC.
If you want to specify the time in local time, then specify the <xref:System.DateTime.Kind%2A> property of the `time` object as <xref:DateTimeKind.Local>.
The <xref:System.DirectoryService.AccountManagement.PrincipalContext> that specifies the server or domain against which operations are performed.
A <xref:System.DateTime> structure that is used in conjunction with the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.MatchType"></xref> to filter search results.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.MatchType"></xref> that specifies the type of comparison to use in the search.

A <xref:System.DirectoryService.AccountManagement.PrincipalSearchResult%271> that contains one or more <xref:System.DirectoryService.AccountManagement.ComputerPincipal> objects that match the search parameters, or an empty collection if no matches are found.

Returns a <xref:System.DirectoryService.AccountManagement.PrincipalSearchResult%271> collection of <xref:System.DirectoryService.AccountManagement.ComputerPincipal> objects that have a password set time within the specified date and time range.
The time will default to UTC.
If you want to specify the time in local time, then specify the <xref:System.DateTime.Kind%2A> property of the `time` object as <xref:DateTimeKind.Local>.
The <xref:System.DirectoryService.AccountManagement.PrincipalContext> that specifies the server or domain against which operations are performed.
A <xref:System.DateTime> structure that is used in conjunction with the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.MatchType"></xref> to filter search results.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.MatchType"></xref> that specifies the type of comparison to use in the search.

A <xref:System.DirectoryService.AccountManagement.PrincipalSearchResult%271> that contains one or more <xref:System.DirectoryService.AccountManagement.ComputerPincipal> objects that match the search parameters, or an empty collection if no matches are found.
Gets a collection of the Service Principal Names (SPN) for the computer account.
A collection of SPNs that specify the names of the accounts registered for this computer.
The syntax for the SPN depends on the underlying store.
